intro: Deuterocohnia recurvipetala, commonly known as the recurving petal fern, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Polypodiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like fronds. The plant has a creeping rhizome and produces small, clustered spore-bearing structures called sori. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided and have a distinctive recurving appearance at the tips. Deuterocohnia recurvipetala thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
